column4: hey team!  i have a ibm t61 laptop.  recently, the battery wasn't charging even when plugged in.  so i had ibm send me a new battery.  i plugged that in and the battery still isn't charging.... ideas?
bent pin inside the laptop or a blown charging circuit.. not uncommon
so you are pretty sure this is a battery problem?
i mean hardware problem
not a battery problem.. charger or connection issue
the os should not have anything to do with the charging circuit...
your battery should charge without the laptop even turned on or running
did you try what I suggested earlier
i'm sorry i don't know what you're referencing

To get live cd to run this often helps..At start or install press F6 and remove Quiet and Splash from the command line. If it still fails.. Repeat and after removing quiet and splash add noapic acpi=off before the "--"
thank hyou
i selected safe graphics mode this time;.... is that likely to fail>?
yes
is it safe to just hard reset comp now?
on livecd.. yes
should the gutsy cd work with nvidia card?  or do i need to dload hardy
It should work with hardy, most of my boxes still run gutsy
with the method you suggested :  i see: "invalid compressed format (err=1)  -- System halted
did you self test the cd for errors?
nope
if trying to install on a dell or hp, burn the cd very slowly
i also have a ubuntu 5.10 cd .. should it handle nvidia cards?  and hopefully has badblocks installe don it?
